# Certification: Residential Child and Youth Care Professional (RCYCP)

## Certifying Organization

[National Resource Center for Youth Services](https://nrcys.ou.edu/) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fnrcys.ou.edu%2F&t=National%20Resource%20Center%20for%20Youth%20Services&c=5cdf3)

The OU Schusterman Center, 4502 E. 41st Street, Building 4W, Tulsa, OK 74135-2512

## Description

A certified staff provides evidence of the value you place on the role of the direct care worker in service delivery. It means your staff will maintain a common knowledge base and residential care philosophy with consistently high values and practices. And certification means recognizable proficiency to placement organizations, licensing and accrediting agencies, funding sources, and the community at large. Certification is essential for the direct care worker's full inclusion in the multi-disciplinary teams that operate in today's residential facilities. It is necessary in their complex work with children, youth, and families.

[More information about this certification](https://nrcys.ou.edu/rcycp) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fnrcys.ou.edu%2Frcycp&t=More%20information%20about%20this%20certification&c=f2110)

## Q&A

More than two years of education or training after high school required? YesOral or Written Exam Required? YesRenewal Required?Every 1 Year(s)Renew through Continuing Educational Units(CEU)? YesDoes applicant have choice of at least two options from above for renewal (CEU, CPD, or exam)? No

## Certification Type

### Core

1. The certification does not have a minimum education level or has an education level below a two-year Associates of Arts or Associates of Sciences degree and the certification does not have a minimum requirement for work experience or requires two or less years of work experience.
2. The certification has an education level of an Associates of Arts or Associates of Sciences degree or higher, but has a work experience requirement of less than 2 years of work experience.
3. The certification has a work experience requirement of more than 2 years but does not require a two-year Associates of Arts or Associates of Sciences degree.

# Certification: Master of Financial Technical Analysis (MFTA)

## Certifying Organization

[The International Federation of Technical Analysts Inc.](https://ifta.org/) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fifta.org%2F&t=The%20International%20Federation%20of%20Technical%20Analysts%20Inc.&c=9f17f)

## Description

IFTA's Master of Financial Technical Analysis (MFTA) represents the highest achievement and recognition by peers in the Technical Analysis community. The MFTA requires an original body of research. It is intended to be a rigorous demonstration of professionalism in the global arena of Technical Analysts.

[More information about this certification](https://ifta.org/certifications/) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fifta.org%2Fcertifications%2F&t=More%20information%20about%20this%20certification&c=4d98a)

## Q&A

More than two years of education or training after high school required? YesMore than two years of work experience required? YesOral or Written Exam Required? Yes

## Certification Type

### Advanced

The certification has an education level of an Associates of Arts or Associates of Sciences degree or higher and has a work experience requirement of more than 2 years, or requires obtaining a ‘core’ level certification from the same organization.

2200 Mill Road, Suite 350, Alexandria, VA 22314

By earning the Certified Transportation Professional (CTP) designation, you join a group of transportation professionals who have made a commitment to the private fleet industry, to an ongoing pursuit of career advancement, and to continuing enhancement of their knowledge and skills.

The certification has an education level of an Associates of Arts or Associates of Sciences degree or higher and has a work experience requirement of more than 2 years, or requires obtaining a ‘core’ level certification from the same organization.

# Certification: Certified Inclusive Fitness Trainer (CIFT)

## Certifying Organization

[American College of Sports Medicine](https://www.acsm.org/) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.acsm.org%2F&t=American%20College%20of%20Sports%20Medicine&c=07ff2)

PO Box 1440, Indianapolis, IN 46206-1440

## Description

In collaboration with the National Center on Health, Physical Activity and Disability (NCHPAD), ACSM has developed a specialty certification for fitness professionals to empower those who are challenged by physical, sensory or cognitive disabilities. ACSM/NCHPAD Certified Inclusive Fitness Trainers (CIFT) give clients the knowledge and support to lead a healthy and comfortable lifestyle.

[More information about this certification](https://www.acsm.org/certification/specialized) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.acsm.org%2Fcertification%2Fspecialized&t=More%20information%20about%20this%20certification&c=1eeec)

## Q&A

More than two years of education or training after high school required? NoMore than two years of work experience required? NoOral or Written Exam Required? YesRenewal Required?Every 3 Year(s)Renew through Continuing Educational Units(CEU)? YesRenew through Re-Examination? NoRenew through Continuing Professional Development(CPD)? NoDoes applicant have choice of at least two options from above for renewal (CEU, CPD, or exam)? No

## Certification Type

### Specialty

The certification corresponds to a specialty within a recognized occupation. For example, Oncology Nurse and Pediatric Nurse are specialties within the nursing field, so Certified Oncology Nurse and Certified Pediatric Nurse would be classified as specialty certifications.

## Additional Details

- This certification is related to military occupational specialties.

# Certification: Certified Laboratory Consultant (CLC)

## Certifying Organization

[American Medical Technologists](https://americanmedtech.org/) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Famericanmedtech.org%2F&t=American%20Medical%20Technologists&c=85b77)

710 Higgins Road, Park Ridge, IL 60068-5765

## Description

The Certified Laboratory Consultant (CLC) is a medical laboratory expert who functions independently in providing laboratory-related guidance to healthcare facilities. The Consultant possesses expertise as a generalist or may provide services as a specialist in one or more disciplines. Individuals working as laboratory consultants can earn recognition for their commitment to quality patient care by becoming a CLC.

[More information about this certification](https://americanmedtech.org/Certified-Laboratory-Consultant) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Famericanmedtech.org%2FCertified-Laboratory-Consultant&t=More%20information%20about%20this%20certification&c=573f2)

## Q&A

More than two years of education or training after high school required? YesMore than two years of work experience required? YesOral or Written Exam Required? YesRenewal Required?Every 3 Year(s)Renew through Continuing Educational Units(CEU)? YesRenew through Re-Examination? NoRenew through Continuing Professional Development(CPD)? NoDoes applicant have choice of at least two options from above for renewal (CEU, CPD, or exam)? No

## Certification Type

### Core

1. The certification does not have a minimum education level or has an education level below a two-year Associates of Arts or Associates of Sciences degree and the certification does not have a minimum requirement for work experience or requires two or less years of work experience.
2. The certification has an education level of an Associates of Arts or Associates of Sciences degree or higher, but has a work experience requirement of less than 2 years of work experience.
3. The certification has a work experience requirement of more than 2 years but does not require a two-year Associates of Arts or Associates of Sciences degree.

## Additional Details

- This certification is related to military occupational specialties.

# Certification: Certified Outpatient Coding (COC)

## Certifying Organization

[American Academy of Professional Coders](https://www.aapc.com/) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.aapc.com%2F&t=American%20Academy%20of%20Professional%20Coders&c=c6958)

309 West 700 South, Salt Lake City, UT 84101

## Description

A Certified Professional Coder-Hospital (CPC-H) is an individual of high professional integrity who has passed a coding certification examination sponsored by the American Academy of Professional Coders (the AAPC). The examination consists of questions regarding the correct application of CPT, HCPCS procedure and supply codes and ICD-9-CM diagnosis codes used for billing facility services to insurance companies.

[More information about this certification](https://www.aapc.com/certification/coc/) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.aapc.com%2Fcertification%2Fcoc%2F&t=More%20information%20about%20this%20certification&c=e811d)

## Q&A

More than two years of work experience required? NoOral or Written Exam Required? YesRenewal Required?Every 2 Year(s)Renew through Continuing Educational Units(CEU)? YesDoes applicant have choice of at least two options from above for renewal (CEU, CPD, or exam)? No

## Certification Type

### Core

1. The certification does not have a minimum education level or has an education level below a two-year Associates of Arts or Associates of Sciences degree and the certification does not have a minimum requirement for work experience or requires two or less years of work experience.
2. The certification has an education level of an Associates of Arts or Associates of Sciences degree or higher, but has a work experience requirement of less than 2 years of work experience.
3. The certification has a work experience requirement of more than 2 years but does not require a two-year Associates of Arts or Associates of Sciences degree.

## Additional Details

- This certification is considered in demand.

# Certification: Certified Plant Maintenance Manager (CPMM)

## Certifying Organization

[Association for Facilities Engineering](https://afe.clubexpress.com/) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fafe.clubexpress.com%2F&t=Association%20for%20Facilities%20Engineering&c=bcfc2)

8160 Corporate Park Drive, Suite 125, Cincinnatti, OH 45242

## Description

Plant and facilities maintenance professionals today must confront a wider variety of complex issues than ever before and therefore must possess an extensive knowledge of the many facets of maintenance management. Earning the Certified Plant Maintenance Manager credential will clearly validate to both your employer and industry officials that you possess in-depth expertise in plant and facilities maintenance management. The CPMM program will also help you remain current with the evolving techniques and technologies in maintenance management.

[More information about this certification](https://afe.clubexpress.com/content.aspx?page_id=22&club_id=244299&module_id=317176) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fafe.clubexpress.com%2Fcontent.aspx%3Fpage_id%3D22%26club_id%3D244299%26module_id%3D317176&t=More%20information%20about%20this%20certification&c=318b7)

## Q&A

Oral or Written Exam Required? Yes

## Certification Type

### Advanced

The certification has an education level of an Associates of Arts or Associates of Sciences degree or higher and has a work experience requirement of more than 2 years, or requires obtaining a ‘core’ level certification from the same organization.

## Additional Details

- This certification is related to military occupational specialties.

# Certification: Certified Specialist Managed Care (CSMC)

## Certifying Organization

[Healthcare Financial Management Association](https://www.hfma.org/) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hfma.org%2F&t=Healthcare%20Financial%20Management%20Association&c=f8954)

3 Westbook Corporate Center, Suite 600, Westchester, IL 60154-5700

## Description

Get recognized as a valued contributor to your organization's financial performance when you earn HFMA's Certified Specialist Managed Care (CSMC) certification.

Those who earn this certification have demonstrated specialist-level knowledge of models, payment rates, benefit coordination, reimbursement, cost-control incentives, legislative changes, and more.

[More information about this certification](https://www.hfma.org/education-and-events/certifications.html) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hfma.org%2Feducation-and-events%2Fcertifications.html&t=More%20information%20about%20this%20certification&c=68685)

## Q&A

More than two years of education or training after high school required? NoMore than two years of work experience required? YesOral or Written Exam Required? YesRenewal Required?Every 3 Year(s)Renew through Continuing Educational Units(CEU)? YesRenew through Re-Examination? NoRenew through Continuing Professional Development(CPD)? NoDoes applicant have choice of at least two options from above for renewal (CEU, CPD, or exam)? No

## Exam Details

Online Exam

The online program includes the course modules listed above and a certification assessment. The assessment has 75 multiple choice questions and you have 90 minutes to complete it in one sitting. The passing score is 70%. If you do not pass the assessment on the first attempt, there is a mandatory waiting period.

# Certification: Medical Biller and Coder

## Certifying Organization

[American Education Certification Association](https://www.aecacert.com/) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.aecacert.com%2F&t=American%20Education%20Certification%20Association&c=056b8)

## Description

Medical Billers and Coders work in physicians' offices, hospital, urgent care center, billing companies, insurance companies and many more places. Their main duty is to process the claims using the codes (current procedural terminology and international classification of disease) and submitting those claims further for reimbursements. Medical Coder gets their codes by reading the patients reports. ​

Medical Billers and Coders need to accurate codes and bill the insurance claims. Moreover, they need to keep a track on the status of the claims submitted, they must maintain patient confidentiality. Apart from these duties the Medical Biller and Coder needs to learn the steps on filling out insurance forms for different insurance companies.

[More information about this certification](https://www.aecacert.com/medical-billing-and-coding-exam) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.aecacert.com%2Fmedical-billing-and-coding-exam&t=More%20information%20about%20this%20certification&c=dc8ac)

## Q&A

More than two years of education or training after high school required? NoMore than two years of work experience required? YesOral or Written Exam Required? YesRenewal Required?Every 1 Year(s)Renew through Continuing Educational Units(CEU)? YesRenew through Re-Examination? NoRenew through Continuing Professional Development(CPD)? YesDoes applicant have choice of at least two options from above for renewal (CEU, CPD, or exam)? Yes

## Exam Details

Third Party Exam Center

## Certification Type

### Core

1. The certification does not have a minimum education level or has an education level below a two-year Associates of Arts or Associates of Sciences degree and the certification does not have a minimum requirement for work experience or requires two or less years of work experience.
2. The certification has an education level of an Associates of Arts or Associates of Sciences degree or higher, but has a work experience requirement of less than 2 years of work experience.
3. The certification has a work experience requirement of more than 2 years but does not require a two-year Associates of Arts or Associates of Sciences degree.

## Additional Details

- This certification is related to military occupational specialties.

# Certification: Certified Interventional Radiology Cardiovascular Coder (CIRCC)

## Certifying Organization

[American Academy of Professional Coders](https://www.aapc.com/) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.aapc.com%2F&t=American%20Academy%20of%20Professional%20Coders&c=c6958)

309 West 700 South, Salt Lake City, UT 84101

## Description

The AAPC offers the CIRCC® (Certified Interventional Radiology Cardiovascular Coder) credential. The CIRCC® credential has been developed by expert interventional radiology physicians, technicians, coders and billers. The CIRCC credential helps validate the education, knowledge and expertise required by the individuals who work in the complex and specialized areas of interventional radiology and cardiovascular coding and charging. .

[More information about this certification](https://www.aapc.com/certification/circc/) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.aapc.com%2Fcertification%2Fcircc%2F&t=More%20information%20about%20this%20certification&c=2e223)

## Q&A

More than two years of work experience required? YesOral or Written Exam Required? YesRenewal Required?Every 2 Year(s)Renew through Continuing Educational Units(CEU)? YesRenew through Re-Examination? NoRenew through Continuing Professional Development(CPD)? NoDoes applicant have choice of at least two options from above for renewal (CEU, CPD, or exam)? No

## Certification Type

### Specialty

The certification corresponds to a specialty within a recognized occupation. For example, Oncology Nurse and Pediatric Nurse are specialties within the nursing field, so Certified Oncology Nurse and Certified Pediatric Nurse would be classified as specialty certifications.

# Certification: Microwave Radio Technician (MRT)

## Certifying Organization

[ETA International](https://www.etai.org/) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.etai.org%2F&t=ETA%20International&c=97642)

5 Depot Street, Greencastle, IN 46135

## Description

Microwave radio still plays a major role in radio and data transmission systems. Wireless carriers continue to deploy microwave systems for data backhaul, and with the advancement of LTE for public safety, the need for microwave communications continues to grow. This certification includes basic knowledge concepts technicians need to know to install, align, maintain, and operate point-to-point microwave radio systems. Prior experience with radio systems and equipment is suggested. This includes core concepts of radio frequency (RF) energy, including how to identify it and safety requirements when working in an RF environment.

[More information about this certification](https://etai.org/communications.html) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fetai.org%2Fcommunications.html&t=More%20information%20about%20this%20certification&c=78384)

## Q&A

More than two years of education or training after high school required? NoMore than two years of work experience required? NoOral or Written Exam Required? NoRenewal Required?Every 4 Year(s)Renew through Continuing Educational Units(CEU)? YesRenew through Re-Examination? NoRenew through Continuing Professional Development(CPD)? NoDoes applicant have choice of at least two options from above for renewal (CEU, CPD, or exam)? No

## Exam Details

Online Exam; Third Party Exam Center

Certification exams available online or through a local exam center, more information available here: [https://etai.org/test\_sites.html](https://etai.org/test_sites.html) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fetai.org%2Ftest_sites.html&t=https%3A%2F%2Fetai.org%2Ftest_sites.html&c=9248a)

## Certification Type

### Core

1. The certification does not have a minimum education level or has an education level below a two-year Associates of Arts or Associates of Sciences degree and the certification does not have a minimum requirement for work experience or requires two or less years of work experience.
2. The certification has an education level of an Associates of Arts or Associates of Sciences degree or higher, but has a work experience requirement of less than 2 years of work experience.
3. The certification has a work experience requirement of more than 2 years but does not require a two-year Associates of Arts or Associates of Sciences degree.

## Additional Details

- This certification is related to military occupational specialties.

The CCM is the first nationally accredited case manager credential. # Certification: Certified Special Population Specialist (CSPS))

## Certifying Organization

[National Strength and Conditioning Association - Certification Commission](https://www.nsca.com/) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nsca.com%2F&t=National%20Strength%20and%20Conditioning%20Association%20-%20Certification%20Commission&c=ae6e1)

1640

## Description

Certified Special Population Specialists (CSPS) are fitness professionals who, using an individualized approach, assess, motivate, educate, and train special population clients of all ages regarding their health and fitness needs, preventively, and in collaboration with healthcare professionals. They design safe and effective exercise programs, provide the guidance to help clients achieve their personal health/fitness goals, and recognize and respond to emergency situations.

[More information about this certification](https://www.nsca.com/certification/csps/) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nsca.com%2Fcertification%2Fcsps%2F&t=More%20information%20about%20this%20certification&c=08da9)

## Q&A

More than two years of education or training after high school required? YesMore than two years of work experience required? YesOral or Written Exam Required? YesRenewal Required?Every 3 Year(s)Renew through Continuing Educational Units(CEU)? YesRenew through Re-Examination? NoRenew through Continuing Professional Development(CPD)? NoDoes applicant have choice of at least two options from above for renewal (CEU, CPD, or exam)? No

## Additional Details

- This certification is related to military occupational specialties.

# Certification: Senior Certified Professional

## Certifying Organization

[International Public Management Association for Human Resources](https://www.ipma-hr.org/) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ipma-hr.org%2F&t=International%20Public%20Management%20Association%20for%20Human%20Resources&c=da6fe)

1617 Duke Street Alexandria, VA 22314

## Description

You've worked in public sector human resources for years, achieving the rank of senior management or executive level. Take your career further with the credential of IPMA-HR Senior Certified Professional (IPMA-SCP). Those who hold this title are experts in their field, they've demonstrated a level of excellence and leadership only the best achieve. Is that you?

Confirm your expertise in the field of public sector HR and demonstrate your commitment to the advancement of your profession with the highly-regarded IPMA-SCP credential.

[More information about this certification](https://www.ipma-hr.org/advance-your-career/get-certified/ipma-hr-senior-certified-professional) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ipma-hr.org%2Fadvance-your-career%2Fget-certified%2Fipma-hr-senior-certified-professional&t=More%20information%20about%20this%20certification&c=69ce4)

## Q&A

More than two years of education or training after high school required? YesMore than two years of work experience required? YesOral or Written Exam Required? YesRenewal Required?Every 3 Year(s)Renew through Continuing Educational Units(CEU)? NoRenew through Re-Examination? NoRenew through Continuing Professional Development(CPD)? Yes

## Certification Type

### Advanced

The certification has an education level of an Associates of Arts or Associates of Sciences degree or higher and has a work experience requirement of more than 2 years, or requires obtaining a ‘core’ level certification from the same organization.

# Certification: Certified Risk Management Professional (CRMP)

## Certifying Organization

[DRI International](https://drii.org/) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fdrii.org%2F&t=DRI%20International&c=769d4)

## Description

The CRMP certification is designed for individuals who have a specialized background in risk management. The certification validates that the individual possesses the foundation level knowledge and experience required to implement and manage a business risk management program.

[More information about this certification](https://drii.org/certification/crmp) [external site](https://www.onetonline.org/shared/exit?u=https%3A%2F%2Fdrii.org%2Fcertification%2Fcrmp&t=More%20information%20about%20this%20certification&c=fe1e3)
